<<<<<<< HEAD
The defence of Iob Throkmorton against the slaunders of Maister Sutcliffe taken out of a copye of his owne hande as it was written to an honorable personage. Throckmorton, Job, 1545-1601.
[39] p.
s.n.], [London : 1594.
Responds to Matthew Sutcliffe's "Answere to a certaine libel", in which Sutcliffe attributes all of the Martinist tracts to Throckmorton--Cf. NUC pre-1956 imprints. Place of publication suggested by STC (2nd ed.). Signatures: A-E⁴. Reproduction of original in the St. John's College (University of Cambridge). Library.
=======
